intro: Matelea stenosepala, commonly known as the narrow-sepaled matelea, is a flowering plant native to Mexico and parts of Central America. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae, which includes milkweeds and related species. The plant is characterized by its showy, tubular flowers that typically bloom in spring or early summer. Its leaves are opposite and ovate, with a smooth or slightly hairy surface. Matelea stenosepala is often found in dry, rocky habitats and is adapted to thrive in warm, arid environments.
